item.title: Waste bins from The Clock House pub blocking entrance from our building, 18th July
item.description:
There are 3 big waste bins from pub on Barry road. These bins are blocking the entrance from our Kings Court building. Also this is a bother to people as these are taking large part of the public path/pavement. Flies are all over them. The pub should have their waste bins inside the premises.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 196a, Peckham Rye, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken water pipe?!, 18th July
item.description:
Noticed spillage of water, but since there has not been any rain very recently it actually is water coming from under the asphalt.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Catherine Grove, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Number 86 being hostile and threatening when taking their “promised” parking space., 18th July
item.description:
It’s been absolutely ridiculous. Parking on clive road has been for the last couple months. Even coming home at off peak times having to park 2 streets away.. it’s a nightmare. Then we have number 86, who regularly put their bins outside their house to reserve their parking space as if they own the road. Insane. What’s even more crazy is that they get hostile and angry when you move to bins or try to reason with them. Police won’t do anything and the council too. Something needs to be done. They aren’t VIPs this road is for all of us.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clive Road, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 abandoned lime bikes, 18th July
item.description:
There are 4 abandoned lime bikes on my street. They are blocking pavements.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Calverley Close, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rats, 18th July
item.description:
I am writing to express serious concern regarding the escalating rat infestation in Churchill Gardens, which has now begun affecting neighbouring properties in Mill Vale. The presence of rats in residential gardens—particularly where children regularly pla is not only deeply distressing but constitutes a significant public health hazard. Residents have reported sightings of rodents entering private gardens which poses clear risks of disease transmission and undermines the safety and wellbeing of local families. This issue requires immediate and sustained attention from the council to ensure appropriate pest control measures are implemented and the root causes are properly addressed. It is vital that the council prioritise this matter and take decisive steps to protect public health, restore confidence in the safety of the neighbourhood, and prevent further deterioration of living conditions in the area. People's health and peace of mind are at stake. I urge you to treat this as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Vale, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The storm drain/grid on the corner of Camberwell Station Road and Knatchbull Road is blocked, 18th July
item.description:
We have cleared all the grids and gutters in anticipation of the amber warning for tonight but the grid that is marked is properly blocked and we cannot unblock it. Can this be cleared please. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Knatchbull Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roundabout road markings missing, 18th July
item.description:
The mini roundabout at the junction of Halfway Street / Willersley Avenue. Road markings at this junction are so indistinct it's difficult to know whether the junction has a roundabout and as a result traffic in all four directions are unsure who to give way to. A simple job just to refresh the road markings.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollies Avenue, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
